intro: Aetheonema, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, cone-like inflorescences. The leaves are typically leathery and have a silvery or grayish underside, giving the plant its common name. Aetheonema species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. They prefer well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making them adaptable to various growing conditions.
